content.html: When it came time to reckon with social media‚Äôs failings, nobody ran to the ‚Äúweb3‚Äù platforms. Nobody asked ‚Äúcan I get paid per message‚Äù? Nobody asked about the blockchain. The community of people who‚Äôve been quietly doing this work for years (decades!) ended up being the ones who welcomed everyone over, as always.

content.html:
@anildash javascript [traps], which implies low accessibility. companies, like wordpress, are moving toward hypermedia-orientation. nobody asks about accessibility either, and yet over 90% of the web is inaccessible. what "people" don't ask for shouldn't be a measure of what is valuable [if] we must assume [metaknowledge] exists.

there's a lot of work to be done but even more obscurity to clear away.

[traps]: https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/javascript-trap.html
[metaknowledge]: https://aeon.co/essays/a-mathematical-bs-detector-can-boost-the-wisdom-of-crowds

content.html:
@anildash fediverse is a mostly-mature system with its own network effects, web3 offerings are not yet. simple as that.

there are people here that work on both.

@10grans tip 0.000001 to @anildash

@anildash For many I've spoken to, like me, who were finding community online before the big social media networks, this feels like a return to the online networks we grew up with - even before the Internet. I've never seen so many excited by the services the Fediverse can offer, without the commercial things that makes social media so toxic.

content.html: @anildash The docs from the Twitter/Musk lawsuit actually showed that was something Musk was thinking of -- but he wanted people to pay for blockchain tweets. Lol. He abandoned the idea. Web3 is a bit in crisis. Play to earn isn't working out that well -- was working on a white paper this week that touches on the collapse of play-to-earn. I also think it's a values issue. People don't want to invest in another corporate owned platform.

content.html:
@anildash too many "apps" and "websites" are imposing javascript on us all, and that isn't fair. it's making us all unfree. we should stop assuming so easily that we must live in a javascript-centric world[0]. the traps are making us less free, and they're an ecological trap[1], too.

[0]: "Consider techniques that utilize static HTML and CSS, rather than runtime client JavaScript compute." https://www.webperf.tips/tip/cached-js-misconceptions/
[1]: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/the-need-for-speed/

content.html: @ellenor @evelyn I mean, it's all good if you want to block me, and certainly I don't expect you to amplify or engage with anything I say. But, having been working on open systems for decades, this seems a bit like saying some email accounts shouldn't be used for work. I'm glad there are anticapitalist and human-centric parts of the fediverse, and I hope they thrive. But me personally? I've been here from the start, so I'm just observing what I see.
content.value: @ellenor @evelyn I mean, it's all good if you want to block me, and certainly I don't expect you to amplify or engage with anything I say. But, having been working on open systems for decades, this seems a bit like saying some email accounts shouldn't be used for work. I'm glad there are anticapitalist and human-centric parts of the fediverse, and I hope they thrive. But me personally? I've been here from the start, so I'm just observing what I see.

content.html:
@anildash With all due respect, which is none, some email accounts shouldn‚Äôt be used for work. If you email me on a personal account on a matter related to my job hunt, if I‚Äôm feeling charitable I‚Äôll answer you off the back of that letter out of my professional address, and if I‚Äôm not feeling charitable you‚Äôll just get a fake failure notice.

This is going to be the longest November of my life. I know it.

content.html:
@anildash@mastodon.cloud @ellenor@bv.umbrellix.org I will probably block you I'm afraid, I block everyone with a large follower account or who is likely to accrue one, something I've only actually needed to do in the last few days, I've had too many experiences on twitter once upon a time when someone with some absurd number of followers would innocently repeat or quote a post, and then this would be the link in the chain for how I'd get some of the vilest harassment I've ever had in my life for several days straight. The variable visibility on twitter is like playing russian roulette with your mental health. some people here call me slurs or throw abuse, but it never snowballs like that, i would take that every single day over the eye of sauron noticing me on twitter

You have to understand that this is is a new threat on fediverse, too. celebrities of any sort were practically unheard of, and now the absurd following distribution you'd see on twitter is being replicated here in a matter of just a few days.

You may be a decent enough person, i honestly don't know much about you, but understand that with enough of a following, you are a loaded gun pointed at every single person you come across, even with the best of intentions,

and then, you're part of an influx which has turned our world upside down. this was my home, it has been for a while, i love its culture, and i don't know if I could even make you understand why i love it so much, because you will probably never experience it. you're in the wrong place for it in some ways, but in others i desperately worry that it's gone forever

this is our eternal november
